body:
Hmm, works for me in master branch. What version of pandas?

In [31]: read_csv('/home/adam/Downloads/data.csv/Lehman_Brothers_Holdings_Inc_1.csv', sep=',', skiprows=range(13), index_col=0, na_values='', names=['date', 'debt', 'mkt_cap', 'percent_mkt_cap', 'ST_OMO', 'TSLF', 'PDCF', 'DW'], parse_dates=True)
Out[31]: 
<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>
Index: 1003 entries, 2007-08-02 00:00:00 to 2010-04-30 00:00:00
Data columns:
debt               1003  non-null values
mkt_cap            1003  non-null values
percent_mkt_cap    1003  non-null values
ST_OMO             1003  non-null values
TSLF               1003  non-null values
PDCF               1003  non-null values

In [33]: lehman.DW

Name: DW, Length: 1003

Okay, this is interesting. The first installed version found was 0.6.1,
possibly because I was running off of master but pandas is distributed with
EPD and installed to an unexpected(?) location.

I'll follow up on this but this issue can be closed. Thanks for the reply.

On Tue, Mar 20, 2012 at 1:00 PM, Adam Klein <
reply@reply.github.com
